Posts.Content: Tomorrow it will be 6 weeks since my robotic prostatectomy on April 12. My surgeon had me start the Kegel exercises 2 weeks before the surgery. My catheter was removed at 10 days and I was totally incontinent the first week although I did stay dry at night. After the first week post catheter removal, I slowly started regaining bladder control and at this time I have 90% control. I have to tighten up when standing from a sitting position, when sneezing, etc. or I will leak slightly. I usually walk 1-2 miles per day which seems to help. I usually drink 1 soda, 1 cup decaf coffee, 2 cups decaf green tea and several glasses of water every day. During weeks 3 & 4 I need to visit the bathroom frequently now I have better bladder control and need to go less often. Hang in there MarkG it will get better!
Posts.Title: Suggestions? Experience?

Posts.Title: Suggestions? Experience?

Posts.Content: Originally Posted by newporter Ask him about some of his recent patients and ask him if you can talk to them. Mine gave me several recent patients to talk to and I got excellent feedbacks. My surgeon also gave me recent patients to contact.
Posts.Signature: July 2011 PSA 3.73 Jan 2013 PSA 5.8 Biopsy revealed adenocarcinoma in 2 of 12 cores. Right Base PTI: 20% Gleason score 4+4=8. Right Mid PTI: 20% Gleason score 4+4=8. CT of abdomen & lungs, bone scan all negative. DaVinci Robotic Laparoscopic Radical Prostatectomy Bilateral pelvic lymph node dissection Internal and external iliac lymph node dissection Nerve sparing on 4/12/13 at University Hospital Columbia, MO, age 66. Surgeon: Naveen Pokala, M.D., M.S, FRCS, Assistant Professor of Urology, Head of Robotic Surgery, University of Missouri Health Center Final pathology shows tumor confined to prostate. Lymph nodes, seminal vesicules, extraprostatic soft tissue all negative. 6/5/13 1st Post-Op PSA <.01 9/11/13 2nd Post-Op PSA Undetectable
Posts.Title: Feedback about my potential surgeon

Posts.Content: I'am 3 months post op and as I remember at 3 weeks I was urinating very frequently with a good stream and low volume. I also would have some bladder pain when I needed to go urgently. Within the past month I've made great improvement now having regained almost 100% continence with an occasional very small leak. Hang in there and be patient, it will get better!

Posts.Title: Strong Stream/ Low Volume

Posts.Content: I am 4 weeks out from my da Vinci robotic prostatectomy and 2 1/2 weeks from catheter removal. Since removal I have been dry every night and usually have to make a bathroom trip at least 1 time during the night. In the 1st week during the day I had considerable leakage using 6 to 8 Depends Pads. After some Kegel exercises, in the 2nd week I was down to 3 to 4 pads per day. I am now in the 3rd week and using 3 pads per day. My squirting and leakage have greatly reduced. I usually walk 2 miles per day and this week started back on my regular exercise routine. My post surgery PSA is scheduled in 3 weeks.
Posts.Title: Week 2 Update

Posts.Content: I am 4 weeks out from my da Vinci robotic prostatectomy and 2 1/2 weeks from catheter removal. My post surgery PSA is scheduled in 3 weeks.
Posts.Title: Week 2 Update

Posts.Content: 3 weeks ago, when I was 3 months post-op I had a similar experience. I was feeling very good and doing so well with continence that I stopped doing Kegels. Over a 3 day period I mowed my 8 acre lawn, cut down several dead trees and made a huge brush pile. A couple of days later I started having groin pain, pain around my navel and stated leaking at a rapid rate. I rested for the next week and started doing Kegels again. It took me 2 weeks to get back to no pain and only very occasional leaks.

Posts.Title: Incontinence is back!

Posts.Content: I had my 2nd post op Drs Appt today and 1st PSA, <.01. Doctor said from my answers and comments everything is going great!

Posts.Title: My 1st Post Op PSA

Posts.Content: I am 9 weeks out from a da Vinci robotic prostatectomy. My worst leaking problems; drinking to much liquids with caffeine, any type of strain ie standing from a sitting position, heavy lifting, etc. If I Kegel down in anticipation of these strains I don't leak. Most of the time I stay fairly dry using on average 3 Depends a day. When I leave the house for several hours I always take a couple of extra pads, wipes & ziplock bags for disposal. I am very happy with my continence level at this time.

Posts.Title: Poll - When do you leak

Posts.Content: My surgeon trained at the Vattikuti Institute and uses the double layer Rocco. At 6 weeks post op the stitching started disintegrating and coming out in the urine in very small specs. Initially this worried me however after a call to the doc and his explanation I understood. It took about 4 weeks for all of the double layer stitching to decay and come out. His explanation for using this stitch was it is the most "fluid tight". At 66 years of age, I've had very good success in regaining my continence. At 3 months post op my only problem is an occasional very small leak. If the stitching contributed to my regaining continence more quickly, thats great.

Posts.Title: The Rocco stitch
